content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Tumbleweed, commonly found in the western United States, is the dried structure of certain plants that are blown by the wind. Kochia, a type of plant that turns into tumbleweed at the end of the summer, is a problem for farmers because it takes nutrients away from soil that would otherwise go to more beneficial plants. Scientists are concerned that kochia plants are becoming resistant to the most commonly used herbicide, glyphosate. In <math alttext="2014" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2014</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="19.7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>19.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of <math alttext="61" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>61</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> randomly selected kochia plants were resistant to glyphosate. In <math alttext="2017" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2017</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="38.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>38.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of <math alttext="52" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>52</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> randomly selected kochia plants were resistant to glyphosate. Do the data provide convincing statistical evidence, at the level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that there has been an increase in the proportion of all kochia plants that are resistant to glyphosate?
